msbt.message: Know what today is? That's right! It's Turkey Day! I can hardly wait to get my grubby mitts on that GRUB! You know we got an award-winning chef here to feed us, right?
Well, here we are at Turkey Day. Don't worry, you'll know my cooking when you taste it, .

You can tell it's Turkey Day by that amazing smell in the air. Let's see, whose house am I hitting up first?Eh, I guess it doesn't matter that much. I'll be knocking on everyone's door today to try their stuff, after all.

For real? Franklin himself asked you to go get him some ingredients? Wow, look at you!Keep in mind, if there's an ingredient you can't find, you could try talking to folks cooking at home about it. Nobody's gonna turn you down for a good cause like Turkey Day!

Franklin asked you to run some errands for him? He needs a few ingredients, huh?Sounds like a big job. If you need help, from me or anyone else on this island, don't hesitate to ask.We're here for ya, !
The big chefs can back up their reputations with meals like you wouldn't believe.The smell alone should tell you that our guy today is the real deal, .
We're lucky to have all these dishes, but you know what they say about too much of a good thing?With everyone cooking, we're well on our way there. Not that it's a bad problem to have, .
Is this heaven or what? I don't know what I should try firstâ€”it all looks too good! Man, I love Turkey Day!
Every fiber of my being wants to tear into this chef's cooking. You'd better hold me back, .
You can tell just by looking that this ain't your ordinary dinner. Why am I still talking when I could be eating?!
You smell that? Unbelievable! This guy is cooking on a whole different level than what I'm used to.What's he got that I don't? Some kinda secret sauce, ?
Food like this sticks with you for a long time after you eat it. I might have to rethink my personal top 10 lifetime meals after this, y'know, ?
Before you eat, listen up! I don't care how good the food is, take it slow and chew every bite!Ah, I shouldn't jump on you. I'm the one who just wolfed down her food and almost choked, .
There's a pile of every kind of food here, and it's ALL GOOD! I tell you, life could not be better right now.
Every meal here is justperfect. It's exactly the kinda thing I need to fire up my imagination in the kitchen.
I can't even take a bite without thinking about what my next course is gonna be. I gotta cool it here. I blame the chef. Who makes food this amazing and then serves so much of it?
The in that looked fresher than a morning sprout.Oh, you brought it? No joke? Solid! I'll keep that in mind while I'm over here appreciating the taste.

Trust me when I say that this would be nothing without the .Wait, you're telling me YOU supplied ? Get outta town! No wonder it's so good!I'm gonna enjoy it twice as much now that I know you had a hand in it.
The manila clams in that looked fresher than a morning sprout.Oh, you brought 'em? No joke? Solid! I'll keep that in mind while I'm over here appreciating the taste.

Trust me when I say that this would be nothing without the manila clams.Wait, you're telling me YOU supplied the manila clams? Get outta town! No wonder it's so good!I'm gonna enjoy it twice as much now that I know you had a hand in it.
Today is Turkey Day, and I ain't takin' it lying down! I'm gonna cook a meal like this town's never seen!

I take Turkey Day real serious. Fact is, I might be too busy to be talking to you now.I'm giving it my A game today. Everyone here's gonna taste my food, and they won't regret it.Can't wait to see the looks on their faces once they've had a bite!

Uhh, was I reading these proportions backward or Maybe it'll work out. Just gotta hope for the best!Things are heating up in here, haha. I wanna go out and mingle, but I still got a mountain of food to cook.

I've been cooking for myself ever since I started living on my own. Turns out it's pretty fun!Not easy, though. I won't sugarcoat it like I do most dishesâ€”I'm havin' a real tough time with this one.

Hey, uh, you think you could track down some for me? Looks like I'm all out.I'm in kind of a jam without any, and I'm not even making jam. I'll give you one of my ingredients if you do!No rush. Just think about it.

Can't help but notice, by the way, that you happen to have some on you.Wouldja believe that's just the stuff I needed? And here I was wondering what I could substitute for it.I'll trade you one of my ingredients for your !
Sure!
I don't know...
It's all good. I probably don't NEED any, when I've got a whole pantry filled with other stuff.But if you do score some, bring it over and maybe I can salvage this thing. I'll still trade you too!
Yikes. Did I seriously forget to grab some ?
Here, take this!
Sorry, I can't help you.
You wouldn't happen to have brought some with you, huh? It'd sure help me out.
Here you go!
I don't have any extra.
Ah, too bad. If you do bring some, I'll open up my pantry and let you have one of my ingredients.It might work out nice for both of us, !
Figures. So it goes sometimes, right? That'll teach me to shop without a recipe in hand, .
Hey, what gives? Don't get my hopes up if you're not gonna fork over the goods, .
Um. No, I was asking for some !Thanks, but you can have this back. Come talk to me if you do get some for-real .
Yo! I can really have this?! Thanks SO much, .Take my in return, OK? It's seriously the least I can do here, .
How's your Turkey Day going anyway, ?
If you want to make clam chowder, you oughta add some scallops.Manila clams will do you fine if that's all you got. But scallops are the way to go for a real rockstar-tier meal.
If you wanna make clam chowder, don't just use manila clams! There's plenty of other bivalves out there!Using a bigger clam will make a bigger chowder. That's just science.

When you make pumpkin pie, you gotta have two things: pie stuff and pumpkins.Different colored pumpkins taste different. So which kind do you use? Well, I'll tell you.Use EVERY kind of pumpkin! You get so much flavor that wayâ€”it'll be more than you can handle!

There's one thing you can't make pumpkin pie without, and that's pumpkins.I dunno if you know this, but every color of pumpkin tastes a little bit different.But you can't go wrong with any of 'em. I mean, come on. A pie's a pie.

If you're wondering what to put in gratin, I got an idea for you. Ready? Dungeness crab. Now, I know what you're thinking. "Crab? In gratin? What a waste!"But that's the kinda left-field idea you need to succeed in the anything- goes world of gourmet cooking!
If you're not sure what to use in your gratin, have you thought about fresh seafood?Crab's in season now, after all. Sure, it's extravagantâ€”but is anything too much for Turkey Day? I say nah.
If you want your fish meuniÃ¨re to be the best it can be, just try adding some barred knifejaw!There's a reason ingredients like that are so expensive, y'know. You can just TASTE the quality, !

Looking to make some fish meuniÃ¨re that's a cut above the rest? What you need is the right fish.I mean, sure, it'll taste decent with any old fish. But on Turkey Day, "decent" ain't gonna cut it! What would get me drooling is some kinda high-quality striped fish. The stripes are where the flavor is!
Thanks for helping me cross off everything on my to-cook list, !No joke, I'd never have done it without those ingredients you gave me, .
I ended up using every ingredient you got for me. Can you imagine if I'd had to just wing it? Yikes!
I was so into my own cooking that I didn't get in much plaza time. Think I'll head over as soon as I wrap up.
I had this whole menu planned out for today. I wanted to include a little something on it for everyone.The only thing better than eating is watching other folks taste my cooking for the first time!
The more I cook, the more creative I get with my recipes. Y'think I could be a real chef someday?It'd rock to have my own restaurant. I'd serve the most unique dishes in town, guaranteed!
You smell that aroma wafting through the entire island? That's the scent of Turkey Day, my friend.It's the ultimate, take-no-prisoners, hardcore gourmet event of the year! BE THERE, !
Everyone on the island is stoked for Turkey Day. I hope you're no exception, !
It's that once-a-year smorgasbord, Turkey Day! You KNOW I'm gonna go hard this time, .

The smell of all that great food is still in the air. It'll fade eventually, but I'm gonna remember today forever.Aw man, I'm getting all weepy. Must be all the onions I chopped today. Here's to next year, .
What I like about Turkey Day is the challenge of cooking for everyone.Did I mess up a few times? You know it. But I learn something new every time, !
I thought I'd get my fill of grub at the plaza today, but nope. Just too busy in the kitchen, I guess.Either way, I had a good time and a few laughs with my neighbors, and that's what counts, .

There was a smaller spread than I thought there'd be at the plaza. Everything there ruled, though.I had SUCH a rad time. And I think I finally learned what actual good food tastes like, .Now that I can really appreciate it, maybe our chef pal can cook for me tomorrow too? And the day after?

Well, I'd call that a Turkey Day for the books.Franklin did a great job with the menu. All that food, and every bit of it was delicious!Guess that's what makes him a first- rate chef. I thought I was hot stuff, but I see I've got a long way to go.Just gotta buckle down and train harder for next year! That's right, Franklin! I'm comin' for you!
How often do you get to feast like that, I ask you? Turkey Day sure is something else.I could gush all day about how good all the food in the plaza was. But you were there. You know, .
What surprised me was how many kinds of dishes came from such a simple setup. That's a pro for you.If I could eat like this every day, I'd be one satisfied customer!
